review: I'm an Android user, and this device does *almost* everything I need it to do.  I use it with my A/V system:- Stream music from Google Play- Netflix- Hulu- Watch Youtube on the TVFor these purposes, it is an excellent device.  I've used bluetooth streaming boxes for my music in the past, and the chromecast is a far superior solution.  The chromecast saves your phone's battery life by taking over streaming tasks on it's own.  For me this is worth the price on it's own.No, it's not perfect.  It occasionally locks up, and not every Android app supports it.  But as software updates are released, and more developers add support, it gets better every day.Biggest aggravation is lack of Amazon Prime integration.  But Android OS is not the same as Kindle, and Amazon has chosen not to offer services such as Amazon Prime Instant Video on Android devices.  There is nothing to be done about this unless Amazon changes it's hardware business model.It may not have as many "channels" as a Roku, but I wouldn't use 90% of those channels anyway.  At $40, the chromecast is dirt cheap for what it does.Oh...and I can pack it in my travel bag and use it on the road--big bonus.
